title: Zurich’s £5.6bn is hard to refuse for RSA shareholders
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Zurich’s £5.6bn is hard to refuse for RSA shareholders The prospective sale comes midway through a turnaround of RSA by Stephen Hester, who has raised £773 million in a rights issue James Glossop/The Times Google+ 1 of 1 The prospective sale comes midway through a turnaround of RSA by Stephen Hester, who has raised £773 million in a rights issue James Glossop/The Times Miles Costello and Deirdre Hipwell Published 59 minutes ago 
RSA and Zurich have an extra four weeks to thrash out the detail of the £5.6 billion takeover bid after the latter tabled a 550p-a-share proposal that appeared likely to be accepted by RSA shareholders. 
The Takeover Panel agreed to give both sides the extension when the Swiss insurer revealed its cash offer last night, hours before a deadline. Subscribe now
